intro: Guatteria pudica, commonly known as the Mexican white bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Guatteria pudica is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests.
